page.title: 03 BUYING A COUNCIL HOUSE
page.content: The Middle Park and Mottingham Estates are run by the local councils. The rent and rates are kept low so people can rent a house or even buy it. Once they have bought their house they can put on an extention or put on porches or leaded or french windows. They can change the front door or knock down parts of the house.If the person has not bought the house then they must ask for planning permission if they want to build an extention also they have to have their neighbours permission because it might block their neighbours light.People that want to buy their council houses can and they are given a discount for the amount of time they have lived there. At the moment the houses on the estates are valued at about 30,000 pounds but tenants can get up to 60% discount.
